titleStmt.title: S. N. Edwards and T. J. Shuffitt to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5569

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
His excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

We the undersigned Justices of the peace of Metcalf county Ky would most respectfully represent to your excellency that we constituted the examining court for the trial of J E Mitchell charged with the killing of John Clark and Sent him on to further trial but granted him bail which he gave He was indicted by the grand Jury of Metcalf county charged with murder and is now on bail We necessarily heard all the evidence during Said examination and most earnestly ask for executive clemency and request you to grant him a pardon We discharged for duty conscienciously and believe that our decision was right and proper but desire that the governor under his power to interpose executive clemency Should exercise that power in this case and pardon the accused

S. N. Edwards J. P. M C
T G Shuffitt J P M C

His excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governer of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Metcalf county and vicinity would most respectfully petition and earnestly request your excellency to pardon J E Mitchell who is indicted in the Metcalf circuit court for the killing of John Clark

James Mitchell
J A Dowel
R. P. Beauchamp
Joseph Baird
